verses.roman:
kṛṣṇera mādhurye kṛṣṇe upajaya lobha
samyak āsvādite nāre, mane rahe kṣobha

synonyms: kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; mādhurye—in the sweetness; kṛṣṇe—in Lord Kṛṣṇa; upajaya—arises; lobha—eager desire; samyak—fully; āsvādite—to taste; nāre—is not able; mane—in the mind; rahe—remains; kṣobha—sorrow.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa's own beauty attracts Lord Kṛṣṇa Himself. But because He cannot fully enjoy it, His mind remains full of sorrow.
